intro: Orthosiphon incisus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf horsegram, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae and is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a useful species for both ornamental and medicinal purposes.
